name: cotillion
content:

[ C ] (also Cotillion) a complicated dance that was popular in Europe in the 18th century: The Cotillion was originally made up of four couples in a square formation. I was assisted by my wife's research on how to dance the cotillion.
[ C or U ] US a large formal occasion where people dance: He escorted her to her first cotillion, and danced with her all evening. A lot of kids are uncomfortable with the formal dancing at cotillion. She has already chosen her cotillion gown. Synonym
ball
More examplesFewer examplesThe evening started with dancing - polkas, waltzes, and cotillions.There was a lively social calendar of balls and cotillions in the town.The city holds at least one traditional cotillion every year.
